intro: Cheilanthes madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar rock fern, is a species of fern native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery, evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and in dry, shaded environments. Its fronds are usually pinnately divided, with a dense arrangement of tiny, scale-like structures on the underside. This fern is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in limestone soils.
